questions.question_text: Which one of the following is the baseline behavior of a table in a privately-scoped application?

discussion.content:
Correct is indeed D:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-application-development/page/build/applications/concept/c_DefaultDesignAccessPermissions.html

Selected Answer: C
the answer is c :
In a privately-scoped application in ServiceNow, the table and its data are restricted to the application's scope by default.

Selected Answer: D
By default, new application tables prevent other application scopes from creating configuration records on application data tables. But reading the Data from the Table wont be a Problem, because for a table "Can Read=true" by default.

Selected Answer: C
In a privately-scoped application in ServiceNow, the default behavior is that the table and its data are accessible only to artifacts (scripts, business rules, etc.) within the same application scope. This ensures data security and encapsulation.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-application-development/page/build/applications/concept/c_DefaultDesignAccessPermissions.html

Selected Answer: D
Table is accessible by default.

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C.
are the comments for different question?

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-application-development/page/build/applications/concept/c_DefaultDesignAccessPermissions.html

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D
Yes, the correct Answer is D

choices.D: All application scopes can read from the table
choices.B: Any Business Rule can read, write, delete, and update from the table
choices.C: Only artifacts in the table's application can read from the table
choices.A: The table and its data are not accessible using web services
